Be willing to talk. They will already ha: Etleetsega go bua. Ba katswa ba setse ba utlwile sengwe. Tidimalo le sephiri gae kake ya sireletsa bana ba rona. Boammaaruri le go phuthologa go ka dira seo. Akanya gore go gontsi gole kae gore baka tlhaloganya. O ba itse botoka!
Allow your child to talk freely. Ask the: Letla ngwana wa gago go bua ka tshosologo. Ba botse dipotso o bone gore ba setse ba itse gole kae.
Always answer their questions truthfully: Araba dipotso tsa bone ka boammaaruri ka dinako tsotlhe. Akanya ka dingwaga tsa ngwana wa gago le gore oka tlhaloganya gole kae.
Your child may be scared or confused. Gi: Ngwana wa gago o katswa a tshogile gape a etsaetsegile. Bafe sebaka sa gore ba abelane kafa ba ikutlwang ka teng gape o ba letle gore ba itse gore o teng ka nako tsotlhe goba thusa.
It is OK not to know the answers: Go siame go tlhoka go itse dikarabo tsotlhe
It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we: Go siame go bua gore "Ga re itse, mme re a ithuta; kana ga re itse mme re a akanyetsa." Dirisa e le sebaka sengwe se sesha le ngwana wa gago go ithuta
Heroes not bullies: Bagaka e seng bakgerisi/ba ba dikgoka
Explain that COVID-19 has nothing to do: Tlhalosa gore COVID-19 ga e ye ka gore ditebego tsa motho ke dife; gore ba tswa kae, kana puo e ba e buang ke efe. Bolelela ngwana wa gago gore re ka nna bopelotlhomogi mo bathong ba ba lwalang le batlhokomedi ba bone.
Look for stories of people who are worki: Batla dipolelo tsa batho ba ba mo tirong go emisa tlhagogo ya bolwetsi le ba ba tlhokomelang balwetsi.
There are a lot of stories going around: Go na le dipolelo tse dintsi tse di phatlaladiwang
Some may not be true. Use trustworthy si: Tse dingwe di ka se nne le boammaaruri. Dirisa metswedi e e tshephegang: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public le https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19 mo makalaneng a WHO le UNICEF
End on a good note: Wela ka dintlha tse di molemo
Check to see if your child is okay. Remi: Check to see if your child is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!
